intro: Asyneuma anthericoides var. grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered asyneuma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy yellow to orange composite flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands or disturbed areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
